tweets.text:
A mile of the River Lugg has been bulldozed to destruction.
Bankside trees grubbed out & burnt.
Riverbed scraped out.
Meanders reprofiled.
Disaster for downstream wildlife.
This was an SSSI.
No consent was sought. 
@EnvAgency must surely prosecute this.
RT
https://t.co/cSBhrR2nDW

We’ve used our powers of entry at the River Lugg #Herefordshire incident

14 specialist officers from @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil now on site gathering information & evidence. https://t.co/LLCOFQHCox
Time for @EnvAgency to step up and make sure the river Lugg  is rescued, and the perpetrators pay for it in full https://t.co/k6jwNof5Fs

Curiouser and curiouser.

The redoubtable @bettwsresident CEO of @WUFoundation making it very clear  that @EnvAgencyMids were alerted to the destruction that was taking place on the River Lugg last week. 

Did EA the respond? If not why not.

Starts 8:37

https://t.co/XbNCDTpqIL

"Be in no doubt that anything less than a prosecution and full restoration of the river, paid for by the perpetrator, will be acceptable”.

@EnvAgency and others want to prove they are fit for the 21st century? Here's your chance. https://t.co/ji0wmcYyhf

Thank you to all the @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency @ForestryComm staff out on site working together to take action on reported damage at the #RiverLugg. Stop notices served and an investigation underway. https://t.co/moayq4k5aR
@POLITICOEurope @BusinessEurope @EUROCHAMBRES @eurocommerce @SMEunited @KadriSimson Can you please help Balkans and Ukraine to get cleaner Air first? @EnvAgency @EU_ENV https://t.co/3cAl5sX4Wb

@DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil Well done - EA Drone operator surveying damage at River Lugg at Kingsland site this afternoon - picture editors more at Alamy Live News @guardian @guardianphotos #riverlugg @TelegraphPics https://t.co/SBFVor1VIu
We're taking reports of environmental damage to the #SSSI at the #RiverLugg very seriously, and are working with @EnvAgency and @ForestryComm to take immediate action. https://t.co/27DINp3vD7

@RobGMacfarlane @silverpebble @EnvAgency Any potential fine was no doubt factored into the plan...they'll pay, if charged, eventually, wait a few years, and initiate whatever plan they had. Fines and complete restoration at their cost is the only real punishment for such wilful destruction.

Some news! After five brilliant years I leave my job leading flood in #TeamEA - but I don’t go far- from today I’m our Exec Director of Operations working with our frontline teams on all EA activities water, biodiversity, regulating industry and of course floods! Can’t wait :) https://t.co/FkeIBPvdth

tweets.text: We're mounting a wide-ranging investigation into reports of damage to the #RiverLugg, which is protected through SSSI status. We're treating this very seriously, working with @NaturalEngland & @ForestryComm who have taken immediate action to prevent any further works at the site. https://t.co/bvhnTETfal

@Feargal_Sharkey @bettwsresident @WUFoundation @EnvAgencyMids @BBCSounds @bbchw @toniearlybird Here is the clipped section on You-Tube
https://t.co/2UIhkTpXIK

tweets.text: @DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil They should be made to accept beavers on their land with large scale tree planting - won’t take a couple of beavers long to sort out the devastation & provide numerous habitats for other wildlife. #beavers

BEFORE & AFTER

Appalling #EcoVandalism at The #RiverLugg SSSI #Herefordshire

THIS IS ILLEGAL ACTIVITY

So it's a CRITICAL TEST CASE for environmental enforcement by @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency @DefraGovUK

The @WildlifeTrusts will be making sure appropriate legal action is taken https://t.co/U8lt4ZuX1t

I’m a little bit proud of this. Can’t claim to have got my hands dirty on the ground but were certainly dirty from a funding aspect. What started in meetings in London and piles of paperwork - ends up in brilliant stuff like this. #LoveWEG @mrbenbayliss @RachB_  @EnvAgencyNW https://t.co/g1h66dwnDG
@DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil The alarm was raised on the 24th November, cannot believe its taken this long to respond
@EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm Can you confirm exactly when the @EnvAgency were informed about this incident?

@The_Skill_Mill @SkillMill_Notts @stwater @MyNottingham @NottinghamFPA @ssemidlands @NottmCastle @Notts_VRU @VisitNotts @exceptionals_uk @EnvAgencyMids Amazing! Thanks so much for getting stuck in and braving the 🌧
